djangotailoring.accounts.backends¶

For users to be able to authenticate with AccessCodes and email addresses, Authentication Backends are required. djangotailoring.accounts supplies three of them.

Authentication Backends¶

All of the Authentication Backends are subclasses of django.contrib.auth.backends.ModelBackend.

Email Address Backends¶

class djangotailoring.accounts.backends.EmailModelBackend¶

Authenticates a user based on an email address and a password.

Arguments:

  • email
  • password

AccessCode Backends¶

class djangotailoring.accounts.backends.AccessCodeBackend¶

Authenticates a user based on an accesscode alone. If there is an email address and password set, the user will not be authenticated.

Arguments:

  • accesscode
groupcode_class¶

In cases where a user enters a Group access code, this backend will automatically create a new user and authenticate with that newly created user. For this to behave correctly, a reference to the proper GroupAccessCode type is required. By default, it is simply djangotailoring.accounts.models.GroupAccessCode.

class djangotailoring.accounts.backends.BasicAccessCodeBackend¶

A version of AccessCodeBackend whose groupcode_class attribute is set to djangotailoring.accounts.models.BasicGroupAccessCode.
